Tuberculosis

  • Overview
  • Logic Model
  • Behaviors
  • Health Outcomes

Overview

We identified 2 studies that assessed the effectiveness of social marketing on behaviors and health outcomes related to tuberculosis.

  • 2 studies found changes in behaviors, including up to 64% increase in TB smear testing.

  • 1 study found changes in health outcomes. The study found a 50% increase in the TB case notification rate and a 52% increase in number of new cases of positive pulmonary TB.

One of the two tuberculosis studies had Strength of the Evidence scores of 4 or higher and both studies had Social Marketing Benchmark Criteria scores of 5 or higher.
